title.narrative: Increasing Access and Strengthening Capacities of Primary Health Care (PHC) to Provide Emergency Life-Saving Health Care Services in Bentiu, Wau and Malakal Protection of Civilian (POC) Site Through the Provision of 4 Primary Health Care Units (PHCUs

description.narrative: This project will provide life-saving emergency and essential primary health care (PHC) services to internally displaced persons (IDPs) and conflict-affected host community member through IOM static clinics, as well as mobile responses through rapid response teams (RRT). Seven static clinics will provide life-saving PHC and referral services, in line with the Health Cluster’s essential health package for primary health care units (PHCU), while the RRT will support integrated responsethrough the Rapid Response Mission (RRM) package. IOM will improve access to preventive and curative health services, covering all domains of emergency and PHC services including immunization , early warning, alert and response system (EWARS)/ integrated disease surveillance and response (IDSR) and response to disease outbreaks, clinical management of rape, nutrition screening, comprehensive HIV/tuberculosis care and treatment, basic emergency obstetric and neonatal care services, integrated mental health and psychosocial support and health promotion.

participating-org.narrative: UNDP MPTF - SOUTH SUDAN COMMON HUMANITARIAN FUND

mailing-address.narrative: New industrial area, Northern Bari, Juba, South Sudan

sector.narrative: Migr Health Assist for Crisis Aff Pops
